meanings.definition: In a manner that follows a straight or direct line of development.
meanings.sent1: The project progressed orthogenetically from start to finish.
meanings.sent2: She walked orthogenetically along the path without any detours.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to move orthogenetically, but it kept spinning in circles instead.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts moved orthogenetically, never straying from the main idea.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed orthogenetically, carving a straight path through the valley.

meanings.definition: Relating to the theory that evolution proceeds in a straight line without branching.
meanings.sent1: The orthogenetically evolving species showed minimal genetic variation.
meanings.sent2: Scientists debated whether the fossil record supported an orthogenetically linear evolution.
meanings.sent3: The orthogenetically designed car only moved forward and couldn't turn left or right.
meanings.sent4: Her orthogenetically organized desk had everything in a perfect, straight line.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes followed an orthogenetically precise pattern on the canvas.
